result.execSummary:
The defendant Eliasar Rodriguez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eliasar Rodriguez in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant ordered to serve 2 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 2 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Target in Milwaukee County

Defendant Eliasar Rodriguez in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Eliasar Rodriguez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
